title: Dannix Ring
text:
Daniel Ring (28 May 1900 – 9 February 1960) was an <a href="Irish%20people">Irish</a> <a href="hurling">hurler</a> who played as a centre-back for the <a href="Cork%20GAA">Cork</a> senior team.
Ring made his first appearance for the team during the <a href="All-Ireland%20Senior%20Hurling%20Championship%201919">1919 championship</a> and was a regular member of the starting fifteen until his retirement after the <a href="All-Ireland%20Senior%20Hurling%20Championship%201925">1925 championship</a>. During that time he won one <a href="All-Ireland%20Senior%20Hurling%20Championship">All-Ireland</a> medal and two <a href="Munster%20Senior%20Hurling%20Championship">Munster</a> medals.
At club level Ring was a multiple <a href="Cork%20Senior%20Hurling%20Championship">county championship</a> medalist with <a href="St.%20Finbarr%27s%20GAA">St. Finbarr's</a>.
